alert.note: Alert for Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:10PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pueblo County through 345 PM MDT... At 310 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Pueblo Reservoir, or 15 miles east of Junkins Burn Scar, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Pueblo, Pueblo Reservoir, Salt Creek, Pueblo West and Colorado City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
